ioformat.images

Class DirectoryCategorizedDataImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ioformat.images.DirectoryCategorizedDataImporter

  • public class DirectoryCategorizedDataImporter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a data load for data which has filepaths in the representation that are to be transformed into a class label. The class assumes a one level deep directory structure and each directory corresponds to a class and the directory name is the class name. This class can also perform selection on the fly and only select certain categories.

      • chooseCategories

                                                boolean copyWhenSelecting)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Select certain categories among the data loaded by this object.
        Parameters:
        selectedCatNames - ArrayList of permissable category names.
        selectedNamesHash - HashMap that maps the permissable category names to their integer indexes.
        copyWhenSelecting - Boolean flag controlling whether to copy the instances when selecting or to only copy the reference.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • importRepresentation

        public void importRepresentation(java.io.File inFile,
                        java.lang.String pathAttName)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method performs the data import when the class of the instances is determined by the paths in one of their attributes.
        Parameters:
        inFile - File that is the ARFF input.
        pathAttName - String that is the name of the feature that holds the relative path data that will be used to derive class affiliation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
